alert.note: Alert for Coastal Wakulla; Inland Wakulla (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 5:08AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wakulla County through 600 AM EDT... At 508 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of St. Marks to 8 miles south of Crawfordville. Movement was northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Crawfordville, Woodville, St. Marks, Wakulla, Sopchoppy, Newport, Shadeville, Hyde Park, Wakulla Springs, Panacea-Wakulla Airport, Arran, Tully, Plum Orchard, Panacea, Shell Point, Port Leon, Medart, Wakulla Beach, Buckhorn and Spring Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
